Oh, hey, for those of you guys having problems running this game on windows XP, such as frequent and random crashing, i found a really simple solution that so far has had me playing for 3 hours straight.

Simply open the SWkotor.ini in notepad and paste the following under [Graphics Options]:

Disable Vertex Buffer Objects=1


Apparently with graphics hardware of the time when this game was develope ran smoother and faster with this setting activated, so it is by default set to =0, which is enabled. Current graphics hardware, meaning most cards from 2006 on will run into this random crash problem. From what i read on the Bioware site, this problem occurs on many different OS's and the solutions are may be varied. 

For XP user's, this solution has been proven in at least 4 cases. As i said, i ran the game with screen resolution of 1400 x 1050, max AA and AF, and i have yet to have a crash.

I really hope this helps all of you having the crash problem, and i apologize if this solution has been previously stated or if it doesn't work.

Ok, guess I'll post this here too. Hope this isn't spamming  . Beazlexd is either very correct or somewhat correct. If you have a newer graphics card it doesn't really matter what resolution you play in. From what I've read it has to do with how SP3 (for xp users) works with modern cards and drivers. Roll back your driver to 177.79 . Since I've done that my computer doesn't know what an error is anymore. Install the game, update it then get the 1.03 nocd from Gamecopyworld. Go in and adjust your graphics the way you want it from the game side while leaving your card controls obedient to the game wishes. If you are using vista or 7 I can only presume rolling back to an earlier driver will help. I'm not sure. Today's cards and drivers try to make the game do things it wasn't designed to do. At least in my demented opinion. I hope this helps somebody.
